text.wiki:
Valle de la Luna (Moon Valley) is situated about 10 kilometers from downtown La Paz, in the Pedro Domingo Murillo Province, La Paz Department, Bolivia.  It consists of an area where erosion has worn away the majority of a mountain, composed primarily of clay rather than rock, leaving tall spires.  It is similar to another zone of La Paz that is known as El Valle de las Animas (The Valley of the Souls). It is an important site of the famous holiday, Dias de los Muertos (Day of the Dead).Because the mineral content of the mountains varies greatly between individual mountains, the sides of the mountains are different colors, creating striking optical illusions. A majority of them are a clear beige or light brown color, but some are almost red, with sections of dark violet.


== See also ==
Valle de la Luna, Potosí, Bolivia (El Sillar)
text.quote: This area with trails is known for its unique rock formations created by the erosion of mountains.
trip: Amazing place to visit within the city limits of LaPaz. It is a little high in altitude so be careful and take it slow. There is a good amount of terrain to explore with tow options, a short loop and a long loop. It closes fairly early so make sure that you plan enough time to

Beautiful place with spectacular views if on a clear day. We were told it got damaged due to social conflict last year but it is perfectly safe now. i would suggest fixing the hand rails which look worn down and not so safe. Also better signs are needed in order to know where to
This geological wonder is in the center of La Paz. Was well worth the visit! Get there with enough time to wander the entire park.

Spent 30.min there as part of a guided visit. Like it. The valley is quiet unique setting and gives as well a partial look onto La Paz. For me it is between 3 and 4 stars. 3 is not enough and 4 is a bit over rated.

Very interesting place. Although there are many Moon and Mars canyions in the region, this one with its columns is completely unique. The atmosphere is somewhat ruined by the smell of rabbit faeces that live there. In addition, it is impossible to buy water in the canyon and the

Yes, it's a nice spot, you make some pictures - and thats it. Around the corner, following the trail - it's all the same. No information boards about this special erosion that has worn away the majority of a mountain. Where are all the rocks? - or was it only "clay-mountains"?

My friend and I were able to hire a taxi driver to take us there and it only cost about $50 US for three hours! It is quite a fascinating place. He also stopped at places along the way to show us stuff and took us to a zoo with llamas and alpacas, as well as other animals

Given how hyped up the Valle de la Luna was in a lot of articles I read about La Paz before visiting, and how frequently it seems to be advertised by tourist offices around the city, I did expect it to be easier to get to. Obviously, we weren't going to pay a large sum of money

This is definitely worth a visit. You can go on your own between 9-1. In the afternoon you need a reservation and then for sunset you have to go by tour. We had our own car and didn't want to pay for a tour so we had to miss the sunset here unfortunately..
Beautiful natural monument, but there's lack of written informations if you decide to make a tour without a guide. A must-to-see in La Paz!

Truly like being on the moon I would imagine. A large clay pan shaped by wind and water to form amazing valleys. A short drive out of La Paz it is easy to access. Not for anyone with mobility issues. Wonderful scenery. A few cacti which it seems will grow anywhere, but otherwise
The view is stunning. You need about 45min to do the big circuit. A nice half day trip. Would visit again for sure!

Cool to see - it’s a 45minute walking track through an amazing valley and you can get some incredible photos. You don’t need a tour to do this, we went to the bottom of the green line on Mi Teleferico, and caught a minivan ($2.50 Bolivianos)or you can grab a taxi ($20) - Entry
Great view from the park, not hard to get there by your own , and entrance fee is fair for the placer, only thing Carry some snacks :)

I always enjoy visiting Valle de la Luna. My in-laws live in San Miguel, so it's an easy trip and wonderful way to spend a couple of hours on a nice day. I also recommend lunch at Hotel Oberland a few kilometers down the road on the way to Mallasa.
It was ehh...but the pictures you take are awesome! You can take a cab and have him stay as you will only need 30 minutes max.
This is a sight to see and the landscape is so different then the rest of the area . Well worth the low cost and a little time to go visit it .
Amassing, different, non earthly landscape, where you can take unique and unusual pictures. Put this on your "to visit list"! There is parking area, shop, toilet, taxi service.
This landscape is worth the effort to see. Get a taxi and have them wait for you while you walk through this weird and amazing natural environment. It can be hot when walking so take water.

Went there by taxi. Our driver waited for us. Easy to buy ticket. There are toilet facilities on the inside. Water and snacks available. I would recommend to this as a thing to see whilst in la Paz. It does not take very long to het there. When we visited there were not many
Easy to get to. Catch a bus from near basilica. Good for an morning out afternoon, interesting shapes.
We did the 2 hours jeep tour in the valley, I've seen better views in south america and in bolivia. Not a must visit

Valley of the Moon is really interesting. The landscape is supposedly really similar to the moon's landscape. It is really nice to wander around and has some really nice scenery and good photo opportunities.
A nice parc to spend some time in and enjoy the geological formations there. It is located a bit outside of the city, be sure to take a good taxi to join it if you don't have a car!

We first heard about Moon Valley from our guide at Lake Titicaca. We were all excited when we saw it was included on our half day tour. It seemed a long trek for nothing too exciting. Yes it was more bizarre than beautiful, it just didn't float my boat. I did take a number of

We went here on the local bus, as part of a tour with a guide. We spent about 45 minutes walking through the landscape as she explained the naming and development of the area. It was interesting and unusual. Take water with you as it gets quite hot during the day. We liked

I was not too impressed with these formations as I am a veteran of photographing rock formations in the Southwest. Tough place to photograph as you have to deal with development all around the formations.

We went by ourselves. It's not so hard to get here a taxi charged us 50 Bolivian money to get there and we were able to stay as long as we wanted. With an agency you just stay like 1 hour so better alone
Really worth visiting. We did not hike the area only drove and admired the view. Breathtaking and quiet.

This place is worth popping up to but it is quite a trek away from central La Paz! The structures are quite something... like a mini Wild West but it is surrounded now by buildings which to me significantly detracts from the beauty. Or perhaps that’s just orientating you to

I did this on one of my last days in La Paz as part of a full day tour that also covered Cachaltaya abandoned ski resort. The landscape here is certainly intriguing and worth a visit. I would say photos can't really capture the outerworldiness that you see in person. The

Part of the la paz day trip first stop here. This is not actually a valley but a fantastic landscape of gullies and spires formed from an ancient bed of eroded rock where you will see eroded geological formations which look something like a desert of stalagmites.

There's only one way to experience this geological inspiration and that is by two wheels and motor. not for beginners but for seasoned, confident riders who know well how to be careful while having fun. Ride free or die.
It’s a good place to visit if you have time in La Paz and don’t know what to do. It’s pretty small, you visit it in about 1h. No need to take a tour as the collectivo go up there for 5bob !

Really interesting site located about 40 mins taxi ride for centre of La Paz. Our hotel organised a taxi to and from the site and our driver waited outside whilst we explored! (Cost 160 BOB) We took the 45 minute loop option and it wasn’t a strenuous walk but offered some really
The moon valley does not take the much time to do and can be done pretty quickly. The scenery is so unique for a city that it is worth visiting and walking around.

We did the short version of the tour as we were running short on time. Clearly, a very interesting place which I can imagine looks a lot like the surface of the moon. Definitely worth the 30 or so minutes we spent there.
You miss nothing if you have not been there. A far better opcion is take the bus to valle de las animas about 40 ñin out of town.
Awesome day trip and worth the 15 bolivianos. Definitely take the local collectivos which are like car shares. No need to pay a tour company commission.
Really great to walk around there. It can easily be reached from La Paz with the public bus. You don't have to do a tour to see it.

It not cool. It is far from downtonw, we got a huge traffic to get there . Neil Armstrong visited Lá Paz in 60's and while playing golf saw the site and sad that the place looks like the Moon surface. Do not waste your time.

After spending a day on the Teleferico cable cars, we decided to head out to the Valley. We took a short taxi ride from the green station but only stayed less than 30mins as this park was insignificant especially after visiting Machu Picchu and the Sacred Valley. You can give
It's a beautiful park with fabulous landscapes. There are lots of trails to walk which give you varied views of the area.

Take the yellow bus out, super cheap, just flag it down outside St Francis Church. Easy walk around, there is only the 1 small tienda outside for snacks and water, nothing inside so if its hot come prepared
A slight challenge of a hike due to the altitude but definitely doable. The views were worth the effort. We saw it late in the afternoon and the sun angle helped with several of the views.
It's a beautiful place, though not the most interesting place I've seen in Bolivia. It's nice to spend a day there.
Easy to do by yourself, get a taxi out and ask it to wait an hour while you walk round. Should cost you Bs80 for the taxi plus Bs 15 to get in. If you have plenty of time go
Interesting rock formations with great views of the snow capped Andes. Only a 15 minute drive from the city, so easily accessible.
Entrance fee is 15 bs and you can walk around1 hour and a half, views is really good and you can take a public car, 45 minutes away from the city

The best place to see something incredible. You are at almost 4000 meters altitude in the mountains ( Andes) and all around you can see mountains of clay. No rocks, just clay. It doesn't have the aspect of the moon but is incredible unreal. You can go with a guide to tour the
Take the Mallasa bus from San Francisco church to Moon Valley, no guide necessary, it's a very interesting place to wander around.
Great place for a walk. Has lots of interesting formations. Also has nice paths with decent rails. Not wheel chair accessible.

This is a place that is just a rock formation that has been weathered for a few million years. They put some paths in and say that Neil Armstrong visited. It is interesting but only for a short period of time.

This is a great place to spend your afternoon in La Paz! It seems very small at first, but we spent much more time than we expected. The attraction was very accessible (aka don't spend money to join tours!) via cable car then taxi. Entrance fee was very affordable, and the
This is such a well preserved and maintained area. It is not developed and maybe it is a bit stark but very much worth the effort

Covering a "fairly widespread" area here are these vertical formations (like tall jagged columns although it's hard to determine their heights with their bottoms quite far down below). I walked the full circuit of the site (which takes about 45 minutes but there's the shorter

This is a must to see and visit while in La paz.. So magnificent area with a natural wonder formation from mud. The walkways are so wonderful and beautiful. You can spend hours in this peaceful place. Dont forget your camera, you will take lots of amazing photos. Highly
We went first thing in the morning. A good idea. The place is sort of mind boggling and so close to the city. A must.

We thought it was ok and enjoyed walking about. The entrance was 15 bob each and the taxi was 40 bob each way to our accomodation in downtown La Paz. It wasn as good compared to other options in and around La Paz.
This was a highlight of our trip. You can't imagine this being real, you feel like you are on another planet.
This place actually could be the moon! It was a bit strange but awesome at the same time walking around looking at the craters and massive rock formations. Amazing nature at work again!
We walked all around this moonscape as part of a half day tour of La Pax. Great views. Really interesting geography.
Before you go, review photos taken on the moon. Then, as you walk the narrow pathways you can fully visualize why this is called Moon Valley.
As the name suggests you feel like you are walking on the moon with the ups and down. Something very different and unique. Nice place to visit.
The walk up to the ridge overlooking the surrounding area and amphitheatre was well worth it - fantastic views.
Because l visited Capadocia several times ,this place wasnt impressed me . I am sure there are better places to visit in Bolivia

Valley of the moon is a short taxi ride from the south zone of la Paz (approx 25 BOB). Entry is 15 bob per person. When we went there were only a few groups of people around the park, which made it feel very secluded like we had the place to ourselves. The rock formations

It is a pity. The country lost a World Heritage Site (UNESCO) due to lack of vision. They let citizens build high-standard houses around this archaeological site. It is difficult to take a photograph that does not show houses, streets and cars. A waste of natural beauty.

It is worth a visit as a break from the centre of the city. It is HOT so take water or buy some before you start the short walk. You can get there by public transport, and if you are going to go all that way I suggest you keep going after the attraction to mallasa to get some
It was an interesting aspect for the middle of the city. However, after spending a week in the wild and beautiful countryside, it doesn’t knock your socks off.

Valley of the moon is a beautiful system of giant spires and canyons. The geological formations vary in color from beige to purple. There are walking paths and bridges that take you through the rock formations which are composed mostly of clay and sandstone. It is an interesting

We booked the tour via Loki Boutique with Maya Tours. Just the most awful experience. And dangerous with no regard for the group’s safety and well being. 1. Maya did not show up to pick up a friend from another hostel and refused to go back to get them. 2. The city van that we

For sure this valley is an interesting geolocical formation. And if this is the ground on which La Paz is built, then it would better not rain too much in the next years. Finally we were disappointed because the whole site has the size of an average clay heap an after all we

Our guide told us that this was named by Neil Armstrong as be said it looked like the surface of the moon. Don’t know whether this is true but it’s a nice story anyway. We spent about 40 minutes here, which I thought was about right. Some great photo ops.

In the city. Amazing attraction. You must witness the landscape to absorb the experience. You can get there by city bus or inexpensive taxi ride. A must visit if in La Paz. There really is no way to express the sensation of the moment. Out of this world? Sort of.

valley of the Moon had potential of being a really special landscape. If only the government had the forethought! Only 10 acres is protected, so the place is becoming surrounded by private homes. It is difficult to get a single panorama of the beauty of this place, without

Went here as part of an organised full day tour with Transturin. It is truly a wonder to see, I’ve never seen anything like it before and has a real Star wars feel to it so. If you’re in La Paz I’d say it’s an attraction not to miss.
Very interesting and wonderful rock formations... Unlike anything iv seen before. Very easy to reach with public transport. Located in a nice town to visit also.

Great place to visit - amazing that it is minutes away from downtown La Paz. One word of caution though - the steps are irregular, walkways do not have guardrails and watch where you walk as the ground is uneven. Not a problem for us but is you have children with you keep them
Very interesting landscape and ambiance (the day we were there, a Christian Aymara group was recording a song, which echoed soulfully through the rocks. The whole site is lovely, and worth a visit.
Interesting landscape and views. We spent about 2 hours walking around, which was sufficient. The gift shops are cute and have nice and unique items.

It was a huge mountainside rock and sandstone formations with intriguing views. Looks like a NASA scientist who visited the moon expressed that the view he saw there was similar. An intersting place to visit

Take the 20 minute walk and it's a walk; the 45 minute one is a hike. Lots of sandy stone steps but the wooden rails help a lot. Sort of looks like the bottom of a cave or the moon and rumor has it ( but is probably wrong) that it got its name from a visit by Neil Armstrong

Had the place to ourselves. $20 from our hotel by taxi (booked by hotel) and were there and back in two hours having left the hotel at 8am. Beat the traffic by going early and returning before “rush hour” at 12:30pm (when everyone goes home for lunch). Interesting landscape and

The Valley of the moon is a really cool place to visit in La Paz. The entrance only costs 15 BOB and you can get there either by taxi, mini bus or take the Teleferico to the last station and from there a mini bus or taxi to the entrance. I recommend to wear comfortable shoes,

We traveled here via taxi. We could've taken the collectivo but were pretty tired and wanted to have get there and back quickly. The taxi waited for us as we walked through the area. The path through the Valley is pretty short so we were in and out within 30 mins or less. The

About half an hour drive pout of town - named by no less than Neil Armstrong! Fascinating landscape with lots of walkways through and around it - wish we'd had more time. Don't be bullied into giving a tip to a musician you haven't asked to play for you!

the Valley of the Moon is unusual geologically - sandstone worn by rain and wind - in a crater formed by glaciers and rivers. Yet it is high, so altitude sickness is a risk. We need some gentle exercise - and this was the place. Entry cost is modest and signage is adequate

I will admit I did not know very much about La Paz before our visit, but this was so very interesting, and, I discovered, has been used as a movie set. If you go, the gifts shops only take cash (USD or Bolivianos), and you may wish to see if admission must also be paid in cash

The valle de la luna or moon valley is a very unusual geologic formation during the glaciers, rain and wind erosion created its forms. Its a nice 45 minute walk. great for pictures, if you are lucky you will see some of the wildlife of the La Paz Valley: hummingbirds, some

While in La Paz we decided to take a look at the Valley of the Moon or Valle de Luna as the locals call it. We booked a cab to take us ther (it's about 30 minutes outside of town depending on traffic), wait for us and bring us back. Round trip 150Bolivian (USD 22). Entrance fee

45 minutes walk in a circular trails with many photo opportunity of the special and unique lime stone and clay formations. a very plesent way to pass an afternoon in La paz. as the city is packed with traffic jams, getting there by texi can take an hour from the touristic

The Valley of the Moon is way down low in La Paz where most of the buildings are up on higher ground. It makes a pleasant walk through the unusual landscape as it can feel like you are really on the moon. Good for many unusual camera shots.

Great geological formations to check out. 15 Bolivianos per person to enter. Not open on rainy days as this contributes to the erosion of the very formations you are heading out to see! You can do 15min loop and / or a 45min loop. We just did the 45min loop as we had limited

We came here as part of a tour. However it rained on the day we visited and we were unable to walk around as it was deemed unsafe. We were allowed in part of it to take photos and it was incredibly slippery so I can understand why we couldn’t walk all the way around. This place

Located just outside La Paz, google to find the easy public transportation way to get there, it is a little bit like a different world. Well maintained you can stroll through this moon like landscape and if you choose your angle properly you even get pictures without

We reached that place by public transportation (mini bus): just jump on a bus heading to "Mallasa" (read "mayasa") and enjoy your ride of 40mins. After 30 minutes ride we asked the driver to stop at the "Parc de la Luna", he called us when we had to leave, and we were right at

I would like to think this once was a huge and beautiful landscape. Now only a small part of it survived (still looking nice), so you can take a walk of about 15 - 45 minutes. But the site is getting totally closed in by quite ugly buildings. We saw them flattening a large piece

I booked this as a tour with Chacaltaya Mountain. But Barro Biking messed up with my booking so I wasn't able to join the tour. My efficient hostel manager advised me that I can take a mini-bus from San Francisco towards Mallasa. It cost me 2.60 Bob. The entrance is a mere 15

Really hot in La Paz spring and we visited moon valley as part of Viator city tour plus Moonvalley. Unique view, natural and walkable paths but the weather was really too hot to do so. Can’t really enjoy the tour. We have seen such view in capadocia but tour guide said it is not

It was a bit of a hike to get out to (we went via taxi in the end) but the terrain was worth it. Super strange, it’s quite an alien looking place. We took the 45 min trail which was lovely. We asked our taxi driver to come back for us (which he did happily).

In La Paz, we got to Valley of the Moon by Teleferico and taxi. We really loved travelling by Teleferico, and it is so reasonably priced. You get great views and transport all in one. We took the Yellow Line and then the Green Line to get in the general area, and then took a

One can see why this landscape was perfect for filming some of Starwars. It is haunting, errie and spectacularly beautiful. There are well marked trails for hiking. Take sunscreen, a hat, walking sticks and water. We spent about an hour, but could have easily remained for

We visited Valley of the Moon with a tour guide who walked us around the park for around an hour telling us about the history. It was interesting and a great landscape. There are some people trying to sell things/busk so take coins if you want to partake in those things.

The landscape was incredible. It was made more amazing by the fact that it was a relatively short and cheap cab ride from the La Paz city center. We were told that per Neil Armstrong, this landscape is one that most closely resembles that of the moon on Earth.

Getting to the Valle de la Luna was difficult, is it just a matter of waiting so be prepared to wait in the sun. It's just how it is though. Once you're there is it really cool. Can get the bus (43, 902 or 273) for 3BOB each and entrance to the Valle del la Luna is 15BOB.

Our visit to Valle de la Luna is a very memorable one. The views are spectacular. Be sure to bring your camera, and have enough time to do the longest of the two routes (I think that one was estimated to about 45 minutes). We had an arrangement with a taxi driver to wait for us,
Almost alien like sand formations due to natural erosion. Walk around for some good pictures and exercise.
We caught a Combi headed for Mallasa and asked to get off at Valle de la Luna - followed the 1 hour trail which gave great views!

Do not miss visiting this place and go with enough time to walk around and enjoy the incredible formation an views. You have a short an a long curcuit with time you can do the long one. Wow what a place looks like you are in another planet

We went there with a taxi from the La Paz city center. It was a bright sunny day and the rock formations were showing in a wonderful light (great for pictures). The walk through the Moon Valley takes about 45 min to 1 hour, depending on how much time you take. It wasn't very
This is a strange and fascinating place to explore. When we got tired we could just scan the view from a high spot.

This place is absolutely incredible for a 2-3hour visit. It has two walking paths (one for 15min and the other for 45min). We took the longer one and got to take great pictures along the way. It looks out of this world and the trail is well defined for easy hiking. Best way to

This is an amazing geological formation and is extensive. We were able to see a large section of these amazing fairy chimneys, which are the result of massive erosion of sedimentary deposits. Some larger boulders have protected the tops of these features to create spires. Paths

It's just a short distance from La Paz. You can take bus number 43 from Plaza San Francisco (very center of the city). It's not that often, so you'll maybe need to wait a while or if you can find direct micro even better. Bus will drive you around 45 minutes, micro maybe a
Nice place but wasn’t anything special. If you have a day spare you can visit it as it’s a 400 bolivianos taxi from the center but I wouldn’t prioritize it.

Pros: 15b entrance 2.5b bus available from main square Interesting to see and good way to pass half the day Cons: All buses are full for the return journey, 40s taxi needed Set next to normal housing neighbourhood so loses its natural charm due to surroundings

Loved my 50 minute trek here. There is an entrance fee of 15b. The view was really nice, and the place was really properly planned. The hike was easy due to the good condition of the roads. It was an easy hike even if u take the 45 mins hike vs 15min one. Would recommend here if

This is an awesome spot, just a cab ride from our La Paz hotel. The driver even agreed to come back and pick us up, and he was thoughtful enough to arrive early when he saw it was starting to rain. A fascinating place. Not of this Earth lol.
Unreal place sole 12km away from la paz CBD. You can go with a collectivo (3bob) or via a taxi (6bob). The entrance is 15BOB... nice location.

We did a tour on a quad bike there and I did not liked it. I was concentrating on the driving (most of the time in streets with other cars) and not on the view. We stoped twice on the way to look at the view but it wasn't enough for me.
A nice well maintained picturesque park in La Paz. From zona central, you just need to take a minibus heading to Mallasa (around 30min) to arrive there.

Really enjoyed this location and being able to wander around amongst all the different shapes set very close to each other. There are 2 walks, one about 15 mins and the other 45 mins to 1 hour. Make sure you visit some of the artisan shops near the entrance.

If you are interested in natural landscape, then Valle de la Luna is a wonderful place for a short(2 hours to half day) excursion from the city. It is easy to get there and tour around on your own. My friend and I went there by taking a mini-bus (going to Mallassa, 4 BOB, 30

Took us about an hour to go there from the Sopocachi area (where in the Ave. Arce there are colectivos that would past exactly at this place). And about the an hour walking around this place. My opinion is that it's a good stroll especially with a group of hostelmates but

This place is 5 miles out of the way, but if you have an hour to waste from Central Lina, the traffic you know, and 5 minutes to take photographs of a Flintstone/Star Wars landscape this is the place for you
The landscape is very interesting and has an eary feel to it, that is how strange it is. It is basically in the city and a short excursion so do visit it when you are in La Paz.

We took a micro bus from La Paz which was easy and cheap. It was a great drive as it gave us a chance to see other parts of the city. The valley itself is really cool and has awesome rock formations. If you have time to kill, this is worth a trip.

We went by the city bus. We had a stop at the valley for ca. 30 min. For us it was enough time to enjoy the amazing view over the valley. With more time you could go different ways through the valley.

You need to go visit Valley of the Moon when visiting La Paz- the landscape looks just like you were walking o on the Moon. Because the mineral content of the mountains varies greatly, between individual mountains, the sides of the mountains are different colors, creating

We were staying in Mallasa when we went here, and despite mixed reviews about it, I really enjoyed it. They had just had a Star Wars event, so there were star wars ships all over - which made it even cooler :) It took about an hour to get through the trail we chose, and the
An OK place to visit. The site is not well policed with many people walking off the designated paths and destroying the surrounding features. There's some good photo opportunities of the landscape.

We visited on quad bike and the valley does have some impressive rock formations. But it’s not a must see. If you’ve travelled elsewhere in Bolivia there are far more impressive and cost efficient attractions in the south.

Moon Valley was just two miles from our hotel. It is a highly dissected area of a muddy siltstone conglomerate. It simply couldn't be built on so it has been set aside and now has a gift shop that might be open or not, restrooms, and trails. It's really stunning to walk through

This place is more than amazing!!!!! There wasn’t a lot of people visiting it which made it more fun and i was able to take as many picture as I wanted. Loved it !!! Make sure to visit this place!! Its very cheap to enter but also very cheap to get there from the city.
Bit like wandering around an "open cut cave" with a range of "stalagmite" type structures. Haven't seen anything like this before.

I visited with a local friend and I really enjoy it .It has nice views of the city from the southern part of La paz.You don't need to take or arrange a tour to visit it you can go there by your own by public transportation which is very cheap.

Only 40minutes outside of La Paz so well worth a visit. You can do the walk quickly, 20 mins, or stroll for about an hour on the longer route. If you keep your eyes open you may be lucky enough to see some wildlife inc. Vizcachas (like large rabbits). The formations are clay
This was a great day trip as we had limited time in Atacama! The guide was excellent and so informative. Highly recommend this tour.

I read a review that explained the public bus route but really glad I shared a cab as the journey was 45 minutes away from our hotel (10km). The cab cost 100 Bolivianos for a return journey. Entry fee is 15 Bolivianos so approximately £1.50 GBP. There was a 15 or 45 minute
Reminds me of Bryce Canyon in Utah but with grey and black colored rock formations. Nice view from the top. Little dangerous as people can push you off the cliff.
Quite a difference to be there - generally as to be on the moon. It is a short travel away fro La Paz. Could be made by taxi or public cab. Significant site for la Paz, as it hasn't lot to offer.

This spot is just 30/45 minutes outside of La Paz. Super easy to get to, just take a collective going in the direction of Mallasa, cost 2.60 bolivianos. The collectivo will drop you off right at the entrance. The entrance is 15 bolivianos and takes about 1 hour if you walk
I had a great time visiting this amazing rock formation. It was a bit difficult to get there but it was worthy. I hadn´t seen anything similar before. I recommend it
Cool place to visit! Is basically a desert with lots crates and lots of hiking paths....we went late in the afternoon and the weather was a bit cool.

I know you can get here by yourself on public transport, but I did an organised tour. The cost was quite small and it was much easier being in a "van" than trying to figure it out for yourself. The landscape is incredible. The 40 min path was quite easy to navigate despite the

We spent about 20minutes at Moon Valley. The clay and basalt structures are interesting and, in some cases amazing. You can do walks of different lengths at the site. A good thing to do on a trip around La Paz.

We did the 45mn tour (you can do the 15mn if you‘re short in time). This „valley“, which was the bottom of the ocean, shows you how beautiful is Nature. The 45mn gives you enough time to enjoy and find peace of mind, and doesn‘t feel „too long“. Take water, not much shadow, and

Valley of the Moon can easily be done in half a day (even on the longer route) and has some interesting and nice scenery. We went without a guide and don't think you would necessarily need one. You can get a local bus from in front of San Francisco church (choose one that says

The landscape is beautiful and the location very serene. At about 1pm a piper stood on one of the pinaccles and played lovely music for a few minutes. The paths are clearly marked and the 45 minute route took me exactly 45 minutes and was only one kilometer. If you sit and
What a wonderful place! I felt like I was on the moon. I was surrounded by sandstone which gave that other worldly feeling. I recommend taking a leisure walk around the Valley of the moon.
We visited the valley because it was part of the chacaltaya tour. It was a special scenery to see , but small and surrounded by city/buildings. Wouldnt recommend if you do not have that much time.

Valley of the Moon is like walking into another planet. The landscape is surreal and alien like. It is a must see to believe it. You can spend an easy hour or two walking around admiring all the different formations. Follow my #30somethinggapyear on Instagram

Pros: This place is beautiful, unique and very inexpensive. You can talk a long walk (45 min) or a short walk (15 min) - both are self guided. I loved the little look outs and view points along the way. You might also meet a flute player who is sweet and charming and will try

Oftentimes, this is combined with the Chacaltaya climb. Does not really make any sense, as one is north of the city and the valley south of it. The drive through the city takes a good 2-3 hours. The valley itself is does provide some nice sandstone formations, but the site is
A beautiful landscape with weird shapes of rocks. Definitely a nice day trip you can do on your own.
Really wonderful to check this out and capture amazing pictures!! A good excursion from an otherwise dreary La Paz!! Also, take a local bus all the way for 2Bs!!

Don't miss the Valley of the Moon if you are in La Paz, especially if you haven't been to Bryce Canyon in Utah (the only place I have seen which is comparable). It is a fairly unique place in a unique and under appreciated city.

I was born and raised in la paz but every time I come here I love it more, this time I came with a foreign tourist and some friends, we had a great time and the rock formations are out of this world Neil Armstrong named it weeell

If you love geology, you will enjoy the features of this moonscape/badlands that is a short ride out of town. Just wish I had more time here but was on a tour and only got to spend maybe 30 minutes here.
This place is really unique,the formations are breathtaking in a serene setting, full of wonder and natural beauty!

Fascinating geological feature, nice walk through a unique natural feature. It’s easily accessible from the downtown. Don’t miss Mario Sarabia’s pottery studio nearby. He uses the raw material from the Valley to create his art.

The Moon Valley in La Paz is very close to the city of La Paz, about 20 min. by car going south of the city direction to Mallasa. This is a geological formation by erosion due to wind, rain and time. We got there by minibus one from the central part to Obrajes plaza Humboldt
short and great walk through this Canyon. It reminded me on Bryce Canyon in the States. the sand is beige and not red though!

There's many way and you can lost your self just waking and will have lots of things to think 🤔, really appreciate that place, many way to get there, public transportation , taxi 🚕, definitely you can do it yourself, you will spend less that half day,hours, don't miss it!

The valley of the moon is a geological oddity created by erosion. Composed of clay and sandstone which the elements have whittled down to spires and ravines with other minerals adding colors of tan, red, and voilet. The site offers trails of two lengths which are 15 and 45
Its a bunch of eroded hills with a subterranean entrance that did not do a thing for me. It is sort on unusual but the steps are poorly maintained and it just sort of weird.

Our hotel messed up one of our tours so arranged for a guide to take us around La Paz. She was indigenous and when she took us here she was able to give us an amazing understanding of the indigenous history along with the current political landscape.

This is another do not miss half day adventure in LaPaz. Beautiful views, lovely mountains scapes. This is about 14,000 feet above sea level, if you are not aclimitized to the altitude do not take the walking tours. Rent the All terrain vehicles.....more fun and a guide will

There are Colectivo's that will take you right from San FranciscoPlaza to the site, it is worth going, very strange rock/dirt formations. Colectivo's can take you back to the city and you can get off close to the start of the cable car line and take it to eL Alto.

If you like moon views and walking, this is the place to visit! Go with clothes and confy shoes! a great hat is a must do! You can walk the entire place in 1-2 hours! Better go on a sunny day! Take some pics, you will think you are on the moon! Visits are during the day!

Some guidebooks are definitely unkind about the Valley of the Moon. It’s certainly an otherworldly rock formation that is unlike anything we’ve ever seen before. From the road it doesn’t look like much but the main walk with photo stops can take around 50 minutes if you don’t

Interesting natural phenomenon. Lots of crevasses, caves and rocks to climb with stunning panoramic views at the top, overlooking the valley. There are also sand dunes here, would recommend wearing good walking shoes (not flip-flops/sandals). We picked a tour later on in the
Given the location it is surprising to find this kind of scenario - Lunar scenery near the city. It's interesting.
I'm always surprised by the power of nature and its artistic power. Amazing place, allow yourself at least one hour to enjoy it fully. Don't forget your cameras!!!
The landscape was so unique and beautiful. The walk itself in the valley was very short (around 40 minutes). Would definitely recommend as a day trip from La Paz.

Made of clay this park erodes each rainy season and according to our guide will one day disapear. Made of clay it has mounds from the ground that replicate the appearance of the moon. At 3000m it is much lower than La Paz anx also warmer.

I've just came back from valley de la luna. The place offers you something totally different and unique. The price was very good (15 bs.). I would like to have more information about how the place created.

The transportation to the moon valley was included in the ‘tour’ to Chacaltaya we booked with Climbing South America agency (can be booked as well in hostels). To Chacaltaya it is only possible to go by tour or own car so we had to do the tour. Chacaltaya was in the morning and

While group touring La Paz districts through the iding and hilly streets, we were thrilled to see the eroded shapes like a mini Nevada Grand Canyon atop the plateau. The bus trip up the mount side was picturesque too so overall the visit to moon valley is recommended. We

For we 💑(Omar and MISHELL), It was a experience very good, because we were on the Moon 🌚, Always I wanted to go with my girlfriend 👫, So today was THE Day 😎, we liked this place 😊, we hope to back up one more 😃, I recomend for the couples 💑❤......
This is a great place to spend a morning / afternoon during your time in La Paz. The rock formations are really interesting / impressive, and the walk is very well sign posted.

Not sure of the entry price, as included in a morning tour. Strange geological site in the suburbs of La Paz. Spectacular....no. Definitely worth a visit if included in a tour. Would not make a specific effort to go and see it. Come from a country with very similar landscapes,
- a little bit far from the city - interesting place - good organization for the trail - very beautiful, unseen

Really interesting shapes in the rocks nd beautiful scenery. It's smaller than I thought - I spent about an hour there and took lots of photos. You can get a collectivo there from the corner of plaza San Francisco and Sagarnaga heading to Mallasa for dirt cheap (45 minutes) and

We caught a collectivo from Plaza San Francisco which took us right to the entrance. This is a fascinating place if you enjoy seeing unusual natural environments. A choice of a short 15 minute walk or a longer 45 minute one.
If you come to La Paz you should see Moon Valley, you don't need to much time to visit I believe. Also our day trip stoped for a 30-40 min only and that was enough.
It is as it says like walking on the moon, it is well set out And takes about 45 min to walk. Not suitable for disabled. We really enjoyed this different scenery!!!
Feel like you are in another world! Just catch one of the mini vans there and back to la paz approximately 45mins. Can't remember the destination name but did find it on trip advisor

Awesome scenery for great pictures. Located in one of the 7 Wonder Cities in the World, you feel like you're out un space. Enjoy the fresh air and the blue Sky. Excellent for Scholl field trips or family outings!
So unique, not far from the city (in part by Teleferico), definitely worth it! There are 2 walks - we did the longer one, took maybe an hour cause we dawdled, took lots of pics.
Our wonderful tour guides -Alex of Late Bolivia- took us here We Had a lovely hike (easy hour when you stop for photos! )
Great experience- there is a small admission fee. I've never seen anything like this- you need to check it out. The mountains in the background make the pictures amazing.
Took a cab out to moon valley, the place itself if alright but very touristy. It's worth seeing if your in la Paz

Enjoyed an hour here walking around and enjoying the scenery, the first thing thzt grabbed me was the quiet after a few days of the traffic and hustle and bustle of La Paz it was actually a welcome relief. Easy to get to by bus.

fantastic place, very easy to get here by taxi (and very cheap); we spent there more then 2 hours to investigate all places and make photos; it's better to visit in the morning otherwise the sun would burn you; take sunblock cream with you and water.

This is a site that you would expect to see in the US Southwest. Yet here it is in the city of La Paz. There is a choice of trails through the area. They are well laid out. Very impressive. We loved it.

Amazing place to see the effect of erosion over tens of thousands of years, the shapes in the clay will leave u fascinated. Recommended to everyone visiting La Paz, and easy to get there with the public transport.

This was a real find in the middle of a big sprawling busy city. Unique landscape and great city views make for a great place to go visit. Was also great to see this part of the city that is away from the bustling center.

This is an easy 2 hour excursion from La Paz. No need for a tour, can get there easily by taxi (and likely bus from Zona Sur). Two trails, one 45 minutes one 15. Worth a visit. to see the cool rock formations. Not at all wilderness though, it´s surrounded by population

You can't miss it! Being in La Paz and not going to the Valley of the Moon is like going to a Pizza restaurant and not eat pizza. It's a close ride from the city and will not take you more than 2 hours to walk around and enjoy this extra terrestrial scenery.

The valley of the moon has dirt rock formations that are appropriate to it's name. After walking in just a few feet in the trails you lose sight of civilization and without trails would get easily lost as walking around where the riverbeds would be with towering rock dirt

I spent about an hour here and covered the longer trail. There is a number of view points to take some good photographs, however, unless you are a geology geek you may find that walking through the landscape becomes somewhat tedious? If you have only a day in La Paz, I would

We did an independent trip by public transport here and it was smooth and safe. The site itself offer all the facilities that one may need, but the surroundings lack on bars/restaurants so bring your food/drinks.

The Valley of the Moon is a quick drive away from downtown La Paz. It is perfectly unique and enchanting enclave imbedded in the middle of the Andes mountains. the entire area has been fitted with narrow foot pats and makeshift bridges, which allow for a pleasant and fun filled
We took the hop bus, the sound doesn't work in most off all seats. They stop by for 15 minutes, more than enough to take some pictures. I wasn't impressed at all.
Super for a day trip from La Paz. There's a really easy path to stroll around the park. Suitable for most ages. Very affordable and easy to get to. Worth a visit.

This place is amazing, worth a visit to get some cool pictures. It's around half an hour drive from centre of La paz. There is a lovely camping village about 2 miles from it, if you want to stay in the area overnight.

The valley is an interesting set of various mud sculptures made by the rain and the wind. There are trails that one can follow to see some of the most interesting shapes. Nothing extraordinary in my opinion.

This place is not worth your time or money getting to. It's surrounded by city and feels like a child's amusement park. Go see valle de la animas for much more impressive formations and it's free (at least for now).
The landform here is amazing, a variety of features in different shapes and special plants. It is easy to walk around with quite a lot of lookout points. Nice nature in the city centre.

The site offers 15 minutes and 45 minutes hike. Of course, there is no limit on time you can spend there. There are nice viewpoints convenient for taking pictures. There is a store where you can buy nicely designed souvenir t-shirts cheaper than in La Paz market. I was not
Very different landscape and conveniently located right in La Paz make it a worthwhile visit. Less than 1 hour is required to walk around the site.

this was part of our tour in La Paz and it’s well worth visiting if you’re in town. Bearing a striking resemblance to the Badlands in South Dakota, this place was undoubtedly created by the same geological forces. While smaller than its US counterpart it is a little better in

When you see this place you will know why it is called Valle de la Lun a. A little far out of the city but easy access on the local buses. A nice place to spend about an hour.Great for the slightly older kids.( 8 and above)
Sure it is original but first, the place smells like a poney stable and second, it's not special enough to go all the way to this place

Visited in early July 2017 as part of a La Paz city tour solely for me. It is just a short drive from the city and is worthwhile but wear suitable shoes, and you need a head for heights. Ideal for photographers as the sun is going down to capture those shadowy visions.

This is a relatively unique place as it resembles some kind of Star Wars film set and it is in La Paz city just South of the city centre.about one hour and a half to explore and overall it is one of the top things to do in my opinion if you are in La Paz
You do not see this just any where, so do NOT miss it. A quick ride from the city by taxi. Paths are marked. Easy climb. Glad they made it a small park.

Interesting landscape. Be sure to find out when it was discovered, and how....then let your climate change opponant friends know! Also find out about the connection to Neil Armstrong. I agree with Gary M, it's not safe for young children, also the elderly, or those not 100%

Valle de la Luna/Moon Valley was smaller than we expected & now being built up and around so seems to have lost some of the raw beauty it must have had. Very busy on a Sunday with families visiting - between noisy families & the nearby gun range?/perhaps they were clearing on
Was nice to walk around and see took many photos. Lots of up and downs and a bit slippery in places. Hard for elderly persons to navigate. Still it was an interesting visit.

This attraction has some interesting geological features (severe erosion in the soft rock), and is a pleasant walk around, if only to escape the hustle and bustle of the city. Entry is quite reasonable, and you are left to wander the site by yourself. I would warn travelers

Valle de la Luna is surprisingly close to the city center of La Paz. It's an OK place to go if you have 2 to 3 hours of extra time. This is nowhere close to a 'must see' in La Paz, but then again, La Paz is not a place with any 'must see' attractions. I enjoyed my stay in La
An incredible site right in La Paz! reminiscing of Bryce Canyon - in a much more smaller scale - right in La Paz. Interesting.
It's a nice 40minute hike. No need to book a tour. A minibus from Iglesias San Francisco will take you in front of the entrance and back.
Nice attraction for about 1hr, only 30BO to get in but don't expect vastness and wilderness as still very near to La Paz...

Valle de la Luna is about 30 minutes’ drive from the centre of La Paz. It’s apparently pretty easy to get here by bus, though for 100 Bolivianos (£12) we paid a taxi driver with a nice modern car to calmly drive us there, wait for 2 hours and then drive us back. The attraction

Your view on the place will be dictated by previous experiences. It is no Bryce Canyon or Kunming Stone Forest, but if you haven't seen them it is an interesting place to spend an hour. It is a relaxing place to walk - the paths are generally good - or just sit and soak up the
You can see similar dirt formations on the way to getting there. They are everywhere. If the called the place "Eroded soil", no-one would bother visiting, I'm sure.

I highly recommend you go and see Valle de la Luna. We were originally going to bike it on our own but when we went with a tour group we realised we would have missed a lot of the cool sites and we would have been exhausted doing from biking in a higher altitude from what we are
nice and easy hike so that altitude doesn't affect you too much. Views are amazing and the price is ok.

I was visiting La Paz and this site is only 1 hour away by cab. I believe you can go by public transportation or Trufi as well, but since it was our first day and only 100 boliviani for the round trip, we jumped in the cab. The driver waited for us at the parking lot. I felt

A decent stop if you have a little bit longer in La Paz. Very easy to get to by local buses and cheap. If you see a guy playing on the windpipes and, like me, it makes you feel you are in the middle of a Western (in a good way) don't forget to tip him like I did. He leaves his

I travelled to the Valle de la Luna as part of a small tour group. It is an amazing place situated about 30 min drive out of the heart of La Paz. You are treated to interested formations, with surreal views. There are many routes that can be taken around the venue so I would
30 minutes out of town, small but nice walk. Take care because it was hard to find transport back to town
With urban development the town has reach this site so what was once a nice place out of town is now a over populated this average site. Just lool at the pictures

Valle de la Luna is a beautiful nature park located a short drive from downtown La Paz. It is comprised of various paths weaving through a truly unique landscape of natural spires of soil and stone spires. The only thing like it in the world that I've seen in Bryce Canyon in the

Nice views and great trekkings, it is a very nice and cheap trip to do in La Paz and you won´t regret being there. Very recommended for a 3 hour trip and you don't expend more than a 100 pesos Bolivianos including entrance and taxi rides.
There are so many other places more beautiful than this in Bolivia! If you are only in La Paz for a short period of time and will not go anywhere else in Bolivia, then do it.

Valle de la Luna is a maze of canyons and giant spires. The formations, composed mainly of clay and sandstone, were created by the persistent erosion of mountains by the area’s strong winds and rains. What remains is a surrealistic setting, full of wonder.There are two circular

There is something with the moon valley that gives me a lot of peace. There are apparently two paths, a 15 minutes one and another of around, 45 minutes but I enjoyed the former and took almost 2 hours. The ticket was 15 pesos and it is easy to arrive there, but it would be best
In the south part of La Paz City, this landscape is an interesting site to discover very nice views. The silence and the sightseeing makes it worth visiting.

Very interesting landscape just outside of la Paz. About a 40 minute taxi ride for around 60 Bs. Or you can bus and cabke car. Cool to see if you have a couple hours to kill! Makes for great pictures.
Relatively close to La Paz, this was a very cool stop. Take your time look at this interesting geographical landscape and just drink in the contrasts of the red mountains around. Do it!

We visited the Moon Valley after lunch on day 2 in La Paz. It is very interesting to see the different shapes that the erosion has left behind but access is limited because movement about the area will cause even greater erosion. There are some nice views from the high points

Easy to get to and worth the visit. Spires and domes of odd colored clay that overlooks the red and brown mountains make for an great landscape. You can walk through the place in about 15 minutes and they have put some steps in so its easy to get up and down. The colors are

The place is very interesting. I took a local bus from La Paz Centro and it took me about 40 mins. You should leave after the rush hour! There should be 273 bus but I could not find the bus number so I took 271 instead from Mexico street. This place is all so interesting!

Although the area is quite large the track does not take long to walk. It is interesting to see the erosion that has taken place and see how they were reclaiming the area, although that has now stopped. You can also look back and get a good view of the city f La Paz from here

This city will disappear if they don't plant some trees, my city is green all year around and here everything is brown with a few trees. This place shows what is going to happen in the future with this place. I got choked !!
Enjoyed our short visit here. It does not takes long to walk the tracks as it doesnt cover a very big area. Was very interesting though and worth seeing

This "park" has two trails through the rock formations, a 15min and a 45min one. If you're driving all the way here, I suggest the 45min trail, though it can be easily done in 30min. The trail, however, is falling apart in places because of the rain (making the path almost too

Moon valley is a small exhibition for interesting natural rock sculptures. It is only 15 BOB to enter and 2.50 BOB each way on the bus to get there, or you can take the teleferico and then a bus - a more enjoyable way!

It's a bunch of erosion effected mud that sort of looks like moonscape. Only problem is you are still surrounded by urban sprawl, so its a bit hard to indulge in the fantasy. It's really hard to breathe due to La Paz's altitude, so thats kind of like the moon. It only costs $7
A very unique location that is not commonly found. We had great photos here. Suggest to spend more than 1 hour to walk to various part/paths.

Valle de la Luna is gorgeous, well thought out and sympathetic walking path - don't come here thinking it's a hike - with a lovely meandering path through the area. The journey up very pretty as well. We just did this all super cheap on public transport Colectivo there - get

Eventhough colour range of the landscapes is contrary to local fabrics, scarce and limited by sandy to grey, with scattered green of cactus and equisetum, the whole scenery gives you very intense aesthetic pleasure to behold. It is certainly worth of a taxi trip, a few miles

It doesn't take a long time to see everything so it is quite a long way out of town for a short experience. It is however very interesting and beautiful and worth the trip. You should be careful when you walk around. There isn't the same level of health and safety as in the UK.

We visited this unique place for an hour or so. The erosion of the land creates an interesting view worth the walk. We did the 45 min circle and enjoyed it very much. It was not crowded but there were others on the trail. This would be difficult for those with mobility issues

Beautiful place, worth to visit. U need only couple of hours. Take a van from plaza san Francisco that goes to mallasa. (Small city right after moon valley). It costs around 4bs one way. Tell the driver u are going to valley de la luna, he will stop there. Entrance is about 15bs

We took the minibus "collectivo" from plaza San Francisco to Mallasa (small village right next to the valley of the moon) for around 4 bolivianos each one way and we asked the driver to drop us off at the moon valley and he stopped right in front of the entrance. The entrance

Interesting is the word I would use to describe this site. I'm still not sure what it was? There was no information in Spanish or English but it was great to see so unusual especially in the city. I will have to look up some information later. We paid a taxi 150bs to take us

There are lots of beautiful geological formations around La Paz but this is one of the easiest to access and it is full of crazy shapes so I'd definitely recommend a visit. We spent around 1 hour at a pretty slow pace so we could enjoy the landscape, but if you don't have much

I would not recommend you to go there. I did not find anything special to see or do there. I went there because the price was the same if we went there or not. You can buy it as a package together with the trip to Chacaltaya. But a green park that was close to this attraction

Cool scenery, not a long activity but great to wander and take photos for an hour. Just manage expectations! Easy and in our experience perfectly safe to get there without a tour, 4B each way on the yellow micro collectivo/bus that comes down the Main Street to San Francisco
Good for one time visit. I took a tour. It is very different experience. It will take 1-2 hr max. Enjoy it.

One of the things that made this trip special is that was an native guy playing the charango over a mountain in the Moon Valley. The walking with the music on the background make a difference. We went on the 15 minute track and we finish it in 7 minutes, so if you got time get
This was ok for an extra of a different tour I was doing. I personally wouldn't bother wasting my time by visiting alone or paying for a tour just do visit
A nice place to go if you are visiting La Paz, at some point you really feel like in another planet. It's a short visit, so it won't take more than half of your day.

It's a nice to see place and the walking path is well maintained. I went with the bus tour from La Paz and they officially only give you 20 minutes to see the Valley. At the end we stayed nearly 45 minutes but that didn't help for people who were back on time. So if you go

Located outside the city it might not be worth the effort to get there. The formations are pretty cool but it's only a 45 minute walking loop. If you do go, take the local bus (vans) to get there. Mallasa or Jupapina.
It's a nice place to see something different and un common, it doesn't take too much time, it's just 45min to see everything.
We went as part of a city tour. Interesting landscape. Toilets, described on the sign as hygienic, had no water to refill the bowl or to wash your hands (son had diarrhea)

On December 31, 2016, I visited Moon Valley, and then did quad biking around the area. It was worth the entrance fee, and the quad biking also was worth it. My tour guide was a great photographer too, which added to the enjoyable experience.

A nice day trip if you are staying nearby in Jupapina like we were. But if you are coming from La Paz then I don't think it's totally worth it. The bus journey from La Paz provides just as good views.
Check it out if you are in La Paz. Definitely worth a visit. We did this as a part of a trip to Chacaltaya, but you can also get here by bus from La Paz.
We went by the sightseeing bus so we only had a 15 minute stop. For us, it was enough. It tend to be very hot in la Valle de la Luna on a sunny day.
This is a themepark version of a natural formation and much smaller than you would assume. Not worth the time, effort or money of getting there from La Paz. Spend your time and money elsewhere.
Small but pretty geological site, nice for a half hour's walk. Beautiful rock formations, beware though as some of the ground is unstable. There is nowhere to buy water here so bring your own.

This place is absolutely amazing. It looks like the pictures of the moon itself. Although some days is a little bit packed because it's very touristic, it is a must go if you visit la Paz. Great places to take good pictures. Go with comfortable shoes and be ready to take of and
It is a fair way out of town , we got there by the cable car then a taxi at the end station . Strange landscape that lives up to its name , lots of photo opps
It's ok. If you ahve time to spare. Sure. You can walk around in 15-30 minutes. The formations are cool but not magnificent.
Unless this is already part of your tour- not really worth a special trip to see. Small area of "Badlands" type of rock formations , which you can walk around in about half an hour.
Definately worth visiting! Beautiful and peaceful place. Views are amazing. Don't forget the hat because sun is very strong there.

A great place to have the moon-feeling of the Andes! We loved walking through the area or to stop and sit and be silent. It is in the south of la Paz and you can spend between half an hour or 3h .... If you have some extra time in La Paz: go and enjoy!

I took a combi for 2.6 bs. to get there. The entrance fee is 15 bs. You do not need a tour guy. There are 2 options when you get in: a 15 minutes hike or a 45 minutes. I did the longest, I loved it!! Very easy to hike...Nobody was there so it was very peaceful, the view is soo
I really enjoyed the visit here. the views were amazing and the valley was great to walk around it passed a lovely hour and is well worth the visit.

Surrealistic landscaping.I agree with Mr.Armstong to describe it as a Lunar valley.Well connected with bus. To be honest I was expecting something larger and a bit more loooked after. But was a great experience.
easy to get too. Really cool way to spend an hour climbing around on weird rocks and looking a cool rodents and plant life.

This is for you if you like rocks. This park is a main attraction for tourists. It displays how the weather and elements have formed this valley of all kinds of structures. The formations look like ones you would find in humid caves.
If you are in La Paz a few days it's fine to go a couple of hours. Moon landscape, nice walk, nothing special.

It is just stunning. Beautiful stone jungle with amazing view of the whole city. It is a bit hard with the transportation. We had a hard time finding the taxi back to the city center. Not even expecting any buses or so. But the place is definitely worth visiting.
I note that most reviewers use the term "interesting", which indicates "waste of time". It is indeed a dry lunar landscape, surrounded by the city's housing. Visit 10 minutes if you must.

This is a great place to visit. The clay formations are incredible - even a little eerie. It is well marked out with paths and steps on gentle slopes which makes it easier for those feeling the altitude. Very different from most tourist destinations. I loved it

Valle de la Luna is a nice place to visit when you have 2 or 3 days in La Paz. You can visit the site in 3 different ways: the first one is a tour that also includes 'Chacaltaya' (a ski resort at 5300m), by taxi or by (mini)bus. We chose the latter of the 3 options. From the big
Did a tour when Diana tours. The information given be guide was very basic but the views speak for themselves. Beautiful!

Either a 15 minute or 45 minute walk through a lunar landscape inhabited by rabbits. Very little vegetation just cacti. A peaceful escape from the hustle and bustle of La Paz. Our guide could not explain how the landscape was formed but it was unique.

Heard about this place has always thought big and wild place. The place is located almost in the city center, a small place with lots of tourists. If there is something more important to do, can be dispensed with.

This is a natural formation and a very unusual and unique one situated in the south lower end of La Paz in a residential area Yes, the formations are impressive but most of The Valley was encroached by and used for high end housing , so the view is really limited I cannot give

Very different topography to the rest of La Paz hence the name. If you are in the area then it's worth a visit - there are a couple of paths that lead you around up and down. The path is quite steep and narrow in places.
Too far , not good, after salar of uyuni, this place is boring taxi is a way to go and to return the bus takes you to city center
Valle de la Luna is like you are on the moon, due to the dirt formations: makes it for a nice and unique day trip, by minibus.
It was a nice ride, but not so impressive. It is not mandatory to do it with a guide! You can just take a bus and do it yourself.
It's not a legend: the first man on the moon name this place "Valle de la Luna" whilst he was playing at the golf court nearby. Well worthy a visit :-)
nice sight but much smaller than you would expect, encompassed in urban developments this is something to do if you have lots of free time.

This is close to the city to organise a visit with a taxi. The place is totally surreal with beautiful views. No need for a guide it's all well laid out footpaths around the site. We took the 45 minute walk and enjoyed it. Wanted to stay longer but we asked the taxi to wait for

We went there as part of a tour and really enjoyed the 45 minutes walk in Valle de la Luna and the view of Devils Tooth. Entrance is 15 Bs for adults and 1 Bs for children. It is important to keep your kids under close supervision when visiting this place as there is plenty

Valle de la Luna, aka Moon Valley, is an area where erosion has worn away the majority of a mountain in La Paz. At an altitude of 3299 MASL, the site is composed primarily of clay rather than rock, and tall spires are left making you think you truly are out of this world. A cool

Neil Armstrong visited this place and said it looks like Moon Surface and hence this Valle de la Luna became tourist famous. Its Ok for one visit. You need to walk a lot with lot of stairs going up and down hence elderly people think before you buy a ticket to move around. Carry

Its a fascinating walk in surrealistic scenery of rock formations and on clearly marked paths. No problem to do this on your own. We took a taxi from Lap Paz center - cost us 40 Bs. They placed a musician in local attire on the highest peak playing lovely flute music and it
Good tour. Fries had good stops extra time at sunset. Left just as it got good though. Would recommend to others for the info. He was funny.

What a place. Do the 45 minute walk around. It is worth taking time to explore the hidden treasures of this place; the many cactus varieties, pebbles precariously mixed within the 'dirt', the shy creatures that pop their heads out and the drop-offs that make you watch where you

Interesting rock formations through out the park. Nice for a half day activity with family, friends or solo. At the entrance of the park there's some shops where you can find artwork by local artists. Worth visiting!

Nice place to reach for an afternoon. Not expensive and easy to walk. Our tour did combine Moon Valley with Chacaltaya mountain that we did not expect to do but which was finally more impresive ! We take the tour from Loki Hostel : the guide was basic ... Minibus okay.

I was skeptical. I wasn't going to visit but decided to anyways. I'm so glad I did. Valle de la luna offered amazing views, and some "unearth" like geography! The landscape is surely one of a kind.

It's 40 mins from La Paz, about 40-50 B$ taxi one way. Costs 15 B$ to get in. It's a marvel to wander around and take some cool shots of rocky landscapes. Do the 45 min route, you will see a lot more than the typical touristy 15 min route. Worth the trip for sure!
Its a very different but interesting place! We went there for an hour and without sunglasses and sun hat it was a little bit to sunny to really enjoy full!

I really enjoyed my visit to Valle De La Luna.. There are a lot of places to explore. I would suggest bringing water, sunblock and wearing comfortable shoes to explore the area. Plan on spending, at least 4 hours. You can choose to hike up some stairs and walk the perimeter.

Very close to the city and easily accessible by any collectivo bus going to Mallasa, this place offers superb views and nice chance to escape from the city chaos. Entrance fee is 15 Bs for international travellers (no student discounts). Well-maintained park with 15 or 45 min

We visited the moon valley as second part of our day tour. The moon valley was much easier to walk around in and amazing geographically. The walk took around an hour is should be done out of the days hot sun. Worth a visit!

I was in La paz late last month into the early part of this month and did a few tours. After going to Chacalyta I vistited this place...moon valley. Really great experience for someone like me who usually travels alone. I met a swedish couple and week walked around for the

This was an included attraction as part of a packaged land tour. There was an entrance fee; but I'm not sure what it was, It is a neat place to visit; although nothing really special. It is definitely not handicapped accessible. The steps can be a little taxing as (keep in mind)

We walked up from Colibri, and it was definitely cool to walk through - full disclaimer, we didn't get a guide - but I can't see someone going out of their way to see it. It's 15 bolivianos per person.

Very interesting visit and for us a must see... Don't forget to take (or buy there) a bottle of water, sun glasses and a hat before you start the visit because altitude doesn't help and you will get tired very soon.

First and foremost . . . HOLD ON TO YOUR KIDS!!! There are walk ways, but wow! Plenty of places for them to fall if you're not vigilant. It was nice, but after having visited the Badlands in the USA, this was nothing. I'd have given it a higher rating, but the low rating is
This was an interesting place for the family to walk around and take pictures for an hour. It is strange how this place takes form and continues to change when it rains,

This was my favorite experience in La Paz. It was amazing and totally unlike any other place I have visited. So much fun to walk around, great spot for fun photography. A must do experience. Be sure to take a good camera. The elevation maybe a problem for some and do take a
Quite different to anything you've seen, a bit boring after a while since all the places have the same look.
Not a great attraction but on a city tour it is worthy of a short visit, they are trying to encourage tourists and this is a historical part.
We had a guided morning tour and were taken to Valle de la Luna. It was pretty cool but just something to have a quick visit. Not somewhere you'd hang around.
Really easy to get to using a mini-bus (micro) or even a taxi. Very surreal landscape. Takes only a few hours to get there do the walking tour and get back to La Paz.

I had half a day in La Paz and my host decided to take me to visit the moon valley landscape. It was a good choice. Close to La Paz and once there you will not believe that such a landscape could exist at such a high altitude but then geological explanations make it simple.

Amazing landscapes and crazy mountain forms! Seriously out of this world. A must do in La Paz, along with Teleferico and Dead Road.

Valley of the Moon is worth the visit. Natural site that is quite interesting. Some shops in the tunnel as you enter the site. Great look at the surrounding hills and valleys as you traverse the various walking trails that provide an overlook to the area.

We got a taxi from our hostel. It cost about 50 BOB each way. There is a bus but it is rather sporadic, tours are also expensive but shop around. We decided to walk around on our own and very much enjoyed ourselves- definately no need for a guide. Easily spent over and hour

The landscape is great! you must take the long tour, not the short one. as long as you walk you will find some signs that tell you the figure you will see, it's a game for your mind, just great. As you have to walk do not go with babies, it's really tiring but totally worth it.
Really Worth tour! Very interesting Rock Formations! It seems you outside the planet! Nice tourist structure too

We enjoyed Luna Valley & were happy we went given its proximity to the city, but wouldn't say it was a highlight of our trip so wouldn't prioritise it over other attractions

It is incredible and let us to think about th nature. You can get the Valle de la Luna by a classical tour with the Chacaltay Montain as well. You leave the city early to go to Chacaltaya and then you get the Valle de la Luna in the afternoon time, going back downtown La Paz in
Valle de la Luna while a bit hard to navigate is incredible. The landscape is amazing! It is desolate and very much lives up to its name.

We visited the morning of our very early arrival. It was an easy 20 minute ride from our hotel in la Zona Rosa. Admission was a few dollars and it is very cool to see. We were exhausted and didn't have much energy to hike around, but it would've been cool to do so. There is not

Very different and beautiful place to visit. The 15 min walk is much shorter, 45 min walk is majestic.

Really cool experience. This place feels like a smaller Bryce Canyon which others have mentioned before. Overall it's a beautiful place with stunning formations.. Only spoilt slightly by the residential areas surrounding it

With gray rock formations and crevices, the Valley of the Moon is appropriately named. It's one of those places that, if you don't stop, you'll think you missed something. If you do stop, you'll ask, "Why?"

We were on a city tour of La Paz and we suddenly arrived at this place (Moon Valley) which really does look like another planet. Great outcrops of stone, which have been eroded away to form, what look like stalagmites. Also has some interesting cacti.
It is better than the mood, Neil Armstrong said. We felt the same way. Great place for photographers. We even had the luck to see strange desert animals, something like rabbits with long tails.

Not a common site seeing location, nature at its best. Make sure you have good shoes and plenty of water.

Totally worth the visit. .. your family back home won't believe the pictures! Take lots of water, as it is hot - and even a parasol - and the sun is probably always shining. I found the few shops near the entrance very interesting and well priced, having seen many similar

It is easy to get there, taking the local bus you get there in a hour. All stars in San Francisco square.

Stopped off as part of a tour. This is an amazing peace of natural phenonima and worth a look. We stayed around 30 minutes but you can take the entire walk around the lunar landscape in around 3 hours. Great ice cream shop across the road......

Very odd place but also quite small and everything is the same. Sure, the place has some striking views but Im not sure Id spend the time going there again.

A very interesting place to see and to walk by, take pictures and enjoy in a very different environment near La Paz downtown.
Valle dela Luna or Valley of the Moon, that's what they call it. A labyrinth of lunar-like surroundings that is definitely out of this world. The wonders of nature never fail to surprise me!

Amazing landscape the likes of which I had not seen anywhere. A must on your visit to La Paz. We got there fairly early on a fabulous clear day and beat the crowds.

Worth a visit to see a lunar type landscape. ... there are 2 options a quick 15 min circuit or the longer 45 min. We did the latter and were reasonably impressed. 45 mins is plenty of time to see all. We (4 of us) arranged for a taxi to take us there and wait the hour before

It's about a 20 minute cab ride from Plaza San Pedro. It really looks like a moonscape in side of the city. They have 2 trails- 15 minutes and 45 minutes but it takes slightly less time. Great place for photos.

Very surreal and uplifting experience! It's like nothing you have ever experienced earlier no matter how much you travel (I've traveled a lot). It's also very safe with security guards and clean and well maintained which is a big plus for me. Five stars! *****

It's for sure a nice place, but nothing special. Go with the public bus from La Paz for 2-3 Bolivianos. Entrance fee is 15 Bolivianos.
Offers a lunar view as we would imagine it to be. Very special and worth the trip. Takes 45 min from La Paz.

We enjoyed our visit to this interesting and unique landscape. The paths are easy to follow. The only downside is that the development that is encroaching on the site detracts from the natural beauty of the spot. Overall worth a visit.

You will never be able to visit a place like this..... Valley of the Moon is a unique experience for anyone visiting La Paz. You feel as if you are really on what we know of what the moon looks like.... Recommended 100%
